trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Slack | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Slack | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Slack with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Slack with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Slack.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Slack.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Slack single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Slack single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Slack will be able to single sign into the application at your Slack company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Slack will be able to single sign into the application at your Slack company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Slack
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Slack

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Slack.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Slack.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Slack.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Slack.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Slack, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Slack, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Slack with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Slack with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Slack application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Slack application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Slack page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Slack page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Slack Sign In URL textbox, type the URL of your Slack tenant (e.g.: "https://azuread.slack.com"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Slack Sign In URL textbox, type the URL of your Slack tenant (e.g.: "https://azuread.slack.com"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Slack page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Slack page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Slack company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Slack company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to to Microsoft Azure AD \> Team Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to to Microsoft Azure AD \> Team Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Team Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Team Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Team Settings section, click the Authentication tab, and then click Change Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Team Settings section, click the Authentication tab, and then click Change Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Team Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Team Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the SAML Authentication Settings dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML Authentication Settings dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Slack dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SAML 2.0 Endpoint (HTTP) textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Slack dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SAML 2.0 Endpoint (HTTP) textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Slack dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Slack dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Public Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Public Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Deselect Allow users to change their email address.
trans-unit.target: Deselect Allow users to change their email address.

trans-unit.source: Select Allow users to choose their own username.
trans-unit.target: Select Allow users to choose their own username.

trans-unit.source: As Authentication for your team must be used by, select It’s optional.
trans-unit.target: As Authentication for your team must be used by, select It’s optional.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Configuration.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Slack, they must be provisioned into Slack.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Slack, they must be provisioned into Slack.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Slack.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Slack.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Slack, a Slack account is automatically created if necessary.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Slack, a Slack account is automatically created if necessary.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Slack **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Slack **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
